item.title: How to easily clear the window.applicationCache on select browsers
item.description: How to 'easily' clear application cache (cache manifest) data for Chrome, and Safari on i-devices.

item.title: Know every version of iTunes installed on your machine? I do.
item.description: Installers for Windows versions of Apple software is stored in a particular directory. Clean it out, and recover space.

item.title: Current, major, browsers
item.description: Listing of the current (major) browsers, with basic versioning information.

item.title: Browser environments for testing
item.description: The three virtual environments I'd recommend for in-depth browser testing, for Web applications.

item.title: Congrats Apple - you've gotten away with it
item.description: Congrats Apple, the recent buzz about Safari 3.1 being a part of your update software has proved that you've gotten away it. [slnet0514:8bf660c2-5a45-4fde-ad22-f36b91d1919c]

item.title: Four working browsers (at least)
item.description: Four browsers on a computer may be a bit much, but not if you're a Web developer. Of course, if you only have one browser, and it's not up-to-date, aren't you being a little lazy?
